docs.title: claude-code-autoyes
docs.text: Simple to toggle autoyes across Claude Code sessions

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• 🔧 Modern Python tooling with UV package manager
  • 🧪 Comprehensive testing with pytest
  • 🎨 Code formatting with Ruff
  • 🔍 Type checking with MyPy
  • 📚 Documentation with MkDocs + Material
  • 🚀 CI/CD with GitHub Actions
  • 🐳 Docker support for development

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/safurrier/claude-code-autoyes.git
cd claude-code-autoyes

# Set up the development environment
make setup

# Run quality checks
make check

docs.title: For Users
docs.text: pip install claude-code-autoyes

docs.title: For Development
docs.text:
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/safurrier/claude-code-autoyes.git
cd claude-code-autoyes

# Set up development environment
make setup

# Install pre-commit hooks (optional)
make install-hooks

├── tests/                      # Test files

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This guide will help you get started with claude-code-autoyes.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.9 or higher
  • Git

docs.title: End Users
docs.text:
Install from PyPI: 

pip install claude-code-autoyes

docs.title: Developers
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository: 

    git clone https://github.com/safurrier/claude-code-autoyes.git
cd claude-code-autoyes

  2. Set up the development environment: 

    make setup

  3. Run the tests to verify everything works: 

    make test

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
import claude_code_autoyes

# Add your basic usage examples here

docs.title: Development Workflow
docs.text:
1. Make your changes to the code
  2. Add or update tests as needed
  3. Run quality checks: 
    make check
  4. Update documentation if needed
  5. Commit your changes
  6. Create a pull request

docs.title: Available Commands
docs.text:
Run make to see all available commands:

  • make setup - Set up development environment
  • make test - Run tests with coverage
  • make lint - Run linting
  • make format - Format code
  • make mypy - Run type checking
  • make check - Run all quality checks
  • make docs-serve - Serve documentation locally
  • make docs-build - Build documentation

docs.title: Testing
docs.text:
Run the test suite: 

make test

Run specific tests: 

uv run -m pytest tests/test_specific.py::test_function_name

docs.title: Viewing Documentation
docs.text:
Serve documentation locally: 

make docs-serve

The documentation will be available at http://localhost:8000

docs.title: Building Documentation
docs.text:
Build static documentation: 

make docs-build

The built documentation will be in the site/ directory.
